thread.title: VIDEO: So plumb and ashamed, George Bailey didn't even wait for umpire's decision | Zee News
thread.title_full: VIDEO: So plumb and ashamed, George Bailey didn't even wait for umpire's decision | Zee News

title: VIDEO: So plumb and ashamed, George Bailey didn't even wait for umpire's decision | Zee News
text:
Follow @ZeeNewsSports 
New Delhi: It may well go down as the greatest walk in the history of cricket. 
In a Sheffield Shield match between Tasmania and Western Australia, former Australia captain George Bailey didn't even wait for umpire to give him out. 
Ashamed after being hit plumb, Bailey walked off without even bothering to look back. When you're so plumb lbw that you start walking before the umpire gives you out #SheffieldShield #TASvWA pic.twitter.com/gnbIGd4v45 
â€” cricket.com.au Video (@CricketVideo) February 12, 2017 
Batting at 44, Bailey failed to made contact to a slow full toss from Hilton Cartwright, which hit his back foot. 
Adam Voges's Western Australia won the match by nine wickets. First Published: Sunday, February 12, 2017 - 23:38 More from zeenews
